column4: No I ran the cd, then it asked me to reboot, I did then it took me to the boot screen, then I hit 'ubuntu'
Then it said now installing, and then the purple ubuntu screen came up
Yea? I hope lol, nit-wit
I installed it earlier via ssh on the windows installer
It failed
I installed it in windows not in the boot screen
In case?
In c*
What do you mean by c?
Well it's still on the purple screen now and I have a very fast computer
for a desktop, maybe ;)
are you booting the CD or an installed OS?
did you MD5 test the ISO before you burned it?
good :)
and do you get the purple screen after you have logged in?
try adding the boot option: nomodeset     may help
I have systems with 16 and 32 cores with loads of ram. I doubt your home pc has much of that, for a home user I'm sure you would think it was fast but in the great scheme of things its not
you may need to add the boot option: nomodeset   to get the video working, Unity needs 3D accelleration to run and if you don't have it out of the box you'll get issues
if you use an nvidia based video chip you may want to use:  nouvea.blacklist=1
not sure how that works with wubi as I don't use it but I'm sure it'll be the same
did you try the boot option?
yes, press CTRL+ALT+DEL and set the boot optin
